Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rzz
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel. I believe that it's the closest to the stadium of Barca, the "Nou Camp" and this is a great advantage. We were on the 15th floor that recently renovated. The breakfast was excellent and the service was very attentive. I 'm not sure that I would take this hotel to a pure leisure trip, since it is a bit far from the famous tourist attractions though the metro is 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great short break”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Barcelona for three nights as a birthday treat. Having read some average reviews of the Princesa Sofia I was a little nervous. But I needn't have worried. We thought the hotel was very good, the staff very pleasant and helpful and the breakfast excellent. The Metro station is close by and we used the Barcelona 4 day Pass for all transport. The nearby Man Go restaurant was good.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars are you serious”
Reviews.Author: Edwardfreedman
Reviews.Content: The hotel, is very tired and run down, although I booked and had confirmation they didnt have a room, they then found me a single room, it was small, stained carpet, looked like it needed redecorating, In the morning its like a railway station, yes its a very good breakfast, how it gets 5 stars is a joke, I stay in 5 star hotels in Barcelona, it is more like 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with the right flair”
Reviews.Author: vitt71
Reviews.Content: I always like staying at the Princess Sofia: it is beautiful and elegant but not overwhelming as other 5 stars. Nice rooms, sumptuous breakfast and a very cordial staff (that is very fast during check-out which I consider a plus!!). What do I need more?

Reviews.Title: “5-STAR EXPERIENCE!!!”
Reviews.Author: PARADISENV
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very clean and the staff is top notch. If you book the club floors, please make sure you meet with Jonathan and Alba, they are the best I have met in the industry. I booked a couple SPA appointments and salon service thru these individuals and was treated like royalty. The club lounge is a wonderful place to relax and have a cocktail or refreshments that I consider to be a meal. The ambiance of the hotel and the professionalism of the staff will have me booking my next hotel stay at the Princesa Sofia. The rooms were large and the turn down service was quite refreshing. Their bathrooms were beautiful with granite, the hotel room had free internet service, and a wine bar - counter which was stocked with goodies. I cannot express enough the GREAT experience I had there and I look forward to returning in June! JHAK

Reviews.Title: “Great break”
Reviews.Author: dave186337
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have been to the Princess Sofia and the second time I have upgraded to a Club Room. The complimentary use of the leisure activities, tapa's and open bar made the stay relaxing and enjoyable. The staff cannot do enough to help and are exceptional. If you want a great hotel in a great city please check this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, so close to Camp Nou”
Reviews.Author: intipuca
Reviews.Content: OK, the main reason that we chose the hotel was for the very close proximity to Camp Nou Stadium. And the stadium is about three blocks away, which was awesome! We arrived at the hotel at about 11AM, and although check-in time isn't until 3PM, they still had two rooms available for us. How nice is that? Special thanks to Carlos, at the front desk for making this happen! The hotel claims to be a five-star property, but I'd rate it more in line as a Marriott or a Sheraton, which aren't really five stars, but they are very nice. Our rate included free WiFi and free breakfast. The WiFi was not really blazing fast and you have to input the username and password everytime you came back into the hotel property. The business center had about 6 computers available all day and their internet connections were blazing fast. The lobby was very nice and the hotel staff was also happy and greeted us everytime they saw us. I reserved a room for one adult and one child and we had two twin beds joined together. It was kind of an odd setup, but I guess it works. The rooms was very clean and had a small safe, a stocked mini bar, two robes, two pairs of slippers, and lots of nice, big towels. The shampoo wasn't really good, as it did not provide enough foam and you really needed a whole bottle per person, per day. But, I simply asked the maid for more shampoo and she quickly got us more than enough bottle. The hotel had a stop for two tour bus companies right in front and taxis were always available in front of the hotel, even at 4AM. It is also within walking distance to a metro station, so getting around was very easy. Our highlight of our stay in this hotel has Pedro, the concierge! He went out of his way providing us information and tips on what to do and where to go. we always went to him for advice on where to dine and he told us exactly where to go, and how to get there. He also called the restaurants and made reservations for us, so a table was always available and ready for us when we got there. Pedro: you rock! All in all, this was a very nice hotel with very nice and friendly staff. I would easily return and stay here on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable, a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: OJFUK
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel in a very handy location. 15-20 mins walk to the congress centre, 2 mins from the metro station 3 minutes from a department store. The hotel was comfortable, the desk big enough to work at and the fitness facilities were very good (but for an extra charge). The decor was a bit dated and could do with some modernisation.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: ShoppinPoppins
Reviews.Content: Main hotel is pretty. Basic room, clean, ok. But amenities minimal (no clock in the room, no wash cloths in the bath, tiny hand soap - no bath soap) and tub is very narrow. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Room service was quick. Overall a good place, but not for a luxurious stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: exeter95
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome choice! Without really knowing Barcelona I couldn't have picked a better hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the bar is quaint (food not so great) and from May-October there is a outdoor German beer garden. The spa/gym is AMAZING. After eating all the amazing food in Barcelona it was great to have a place to work out, take a dip and get a massage. The hotel location is outside the old areas of Barcelona, but taxis are super cheap in the city and the metro is very easy to use. The hotel is somewhat pricey for Barcelona, but nothing compared to Paris or New York! I will stay here again when I return. *I would say 4 star though not 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Tomasini
Reviews.Content: Old, but still a very nice hotel.Great breakfast, staff always willing to please. Far from city center but good public transports at hand in the "Avinguda Diagonal".

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star, but OK”
Reviews.Author: sabadellexpatbrit
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel, 150 euros including breakfast for an evening business meeting. Duty Manager called as soon as we were in room to make sure all ok. I noticed the breakfast price was 30 euros per person, but breakfast was great, no question. Buffet style, bacon eggs, mushrooms, sausages, hams, cheese, rolls, jams, fruits etc. Staff spoke English to varying levels and seemed pleased to help. Room was clean but a little tired and obviously in need of a re-decoration. Room was a good size. It is important to remember room size is an integral part of the Spanish hotel star system. As there is no international star system for hotels, (really!!) comforts can change as you travel. However, our room had hairdryer, TV, safe, etc. No trouser press. Minibar but with insane prices, so take your own drinking water (you dont want to drink Barcelona tap water; healthwise ok, but awful taste), soft drinks, night caps etc. Location is not fantastic for the city, you will need to take Metro or taxi, so consider that. Do not take taxis from outside the hotel, walk down the road a bit and hail one. A lot cheaper. All in all, a good hotel for conferences, visiting Camp Nou or for weekend breaks if you get an good offer from their webpage, but for longer stays visiting the city, perhaps I would want to stay a little closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, dated accents”
Reviews.Author: trapizumac7
Reviews.Content: The rooms were decently sized and had all the amenities as expected. However, the furniture and parts of the room were very well worn and noticable. I was there for a business conference, so all the breaks and lunches were provided by the hotel. It was a great selection of local dishes and fresh ingredients. The service was immpeccable and most of the staff spoke English (if you don't speak Spanish).

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel: the good, the bad and the ugly.”
Reviews.Author: annaSa0Paul0
Reviews.Content: This is an average Hotel. This is not a 5 star hotel. Since I've stayed in this hotel for 9 days, I will tell you its pros and cons: Let's begin with the PROS: 1) Excelent Location: On Av. Diagonal. Easy access (2 blocks) to the Metro and less than 1 block to TRAM. 2) Very Good GYM / SPA: If you are a guest in the hotel, you have to pay 12 euros per day to use the Acqua Gym Spa. The gym is big, the swimming pool is heated (perfect temperature, not too cold or hot), 20 meters, you can borrow caps and - if available - goggles. There are treadmills, I think 4 or 5, don't remember and other gym equipments. Beware that they have a free 'mini gym' too, but it is too small, only one treadmill. If you are lucky, you can find it empty. 3) Breakfast. The breakfast is the only 5-star thing is this hotel. Wide variety of fresh fruits, parma ham, cheese, breads, croissants, juices... CONS: 1) Very Poor free wireless connection: It is a good thing that we don't have to pay for wi-fi connection. However, I tried to work from the hotel and access the VPN of my company, but that was sooo slow, that I ended up giving up. Of course, Skype video calls were poor also. 2) Staff (with a very few exception) were just okay. At your first day they are all friendly and helpful, but after your third day there, they don't even bother to say good morning. They are ok. 3) Rooms. The rooms are big and quiet (that's the only excelent aspect of the rooms). My room had an old carpet with stains. I believe all rooms are carpeted. The curtains were not working properly, one of its parts got stucked on the metal rail. The TV was okay: lots of local and worldwide channels. The bathroom is large, but you have to call the room service if you need more than a soap, a conditioner or a shampoo. (I needed a shower cap and I had to call the reception). 4) Food (room service). This was the ugly aspect. I was very satisfied with the food on this hotel. However, on the last day, I ate a sandwich with mayo and eggs (yes, I know... what I was thinking?!?) and I got a food poisoning. So, beware with the food.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: oneyearoff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Mobile World Congress in February. It's a large but comfortable business hotel. My room was standard but the bed and linens were good. The buffet breakfast is outstanding - truly, anything you could possibly want was available. The location, though, isn't the best. It's far, far away from the charming restaurants and attractions of Barcelona. We took a 20-25 minute cab ride every night for dinner. The metro isn't too far away, but you usually need to change lines at least once to get where you want to go in the Gothic area. It's apparently close to Camp Nou, the soccer stadium, so that could be a plus. Bottom line - fine for business, but you can do much better for a vacation hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed hotel, a good base.”
Reviews.Author: jgcbdsgte
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as a family for a weekend break to Barcelona, we had booked a club room. We booked this hotel as we wanted to do the tour of the Camp Nou and also to be within easy access to the Ramblas and Port Vell. This hotel delivers this as 5 mins walk and you are on the underground to both of the above. We arrived early (11.00am) and luckily enough they had a room which was available, so dropped bags of and a short walk to the Nou Camp. The rooms are looking a bit dated and are certainly more 4 star these days than 5 but were functional if you weren't in them for too long. The club lounge was great, we called in a couple of times to help ourselves to a drink or snack, the staff were most helpful and arranged the complimentary massage for the wife. We used the pool in the morning and this again was great to use for all of the family and is included in the price of the club rooms. We were allowed a late check out as well, so that we could call back to collect our bags on the way back to the airport. We found the underground easy to use as always and used a t10 card between us for €10, so cheap to use. On previous visits we have stayed at the Arts and the Skipper and whilst a bit further out and the rooms are more dated, we felt we got great value by using the club rooms and also the easy access to the Camp Nou suited us.

Reviews.Title: “the club lounge”
Reviews.Author: Olivia R
Reviews.Content: we stay every year at the princesa sofia hotel - we stay upstairs in the club lounge - the best place in barcelona to stay - the staff are friendly and helpful (english speaking) and go out of their way to ensure your stay is everything you want it to be - you avoid the hassle of the main reception by staying in the club lounge - and it gives you somewhere to go and chill outside your room. tanya from australia :)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service!”
Reviews.Author: Louise552
Reviews.Content: I recently had to make a trip to Barcelona and picked the hotel based on it being good value. Even off-peak, the price seemed far too good for a 5* hotel and I doubted whether it would really be up to standard. I need not have worried, the room was perfect - smart bathroom & comfortable, clean room with soft pillows and even BBC channels and sport on the television. I can't fault the service I received. I forgot a UK adapter and one was brought up to my room within minutes of requesting it. The facilities were great - free mini-gym and also access to a spa & fitness centre for only 12 euros. The breakfast offered enough variety and the waiter immediately fetched tea or coffee. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. No waiting around when checking-in or out. There was also a special offer when booking my room on-line of free wi-fi during my stay. I was so impressed I've been back again!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Good if you like Football”
Reviews.Author: SaffyPig
Reviews.Content: Like many other i stayed here for business. It’s a functional and bland typical hotel chain rooms. People stay here for two reasons, Conferences or the fact it’s a stone’s throw from the Footy stadium. ( there was a match one night, they play past Midnight and the lovely sounds of the cars honking as they won!) It is nowhere near any of the great attractions Barcelona has to offer, you would need to cab and metro everywhere. Food is average too. So it was fine, i would not pay to stay here on my own dime. Also they did not have a single TV channel in English, i find that very rude as a business traveller, even a BBC or CNN would have been welcome to break the evening boredom, as they obviously cater to international visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatK2000
Reviews.Content: Rooms a bit tired 1980's styling but actually have everything you need. Spacious bathrooms, lashings of hot water, super soft bed.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, large rooms, good conference venue”
Reviews.Author: gosaka
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at this property for a company event. The accommodations and facilities were good in a older property. The rooms are reasonable large and comfortable. Catering and restaurants were good and service was cordial and helpful. The property has both a spa/gym and a small free exercise facility. I enjoyed heading outside for jogs along the Diagonal and into the nearby university campus. It can be a little crazy when the football stadium nearby is open for an event. I

Reviews.Title: “Good for Camp Nou but not so much for centre”
Reviews.Author: HotelExpertSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business recently as I was attending a huge trade show in the city. The hotel was chosen for me but I was happy with the quality of everything. The room was a decent size with a great view. The food was of a very high standard. If you are visiting Barcelona to watch a football match at the Camp Nou, then I would say that the location is superb. Barca were at home on the night I stayed and I saw several people going to the stadium. However, the location is not so good if you are visiting the city to see the sights. That said, the hotel is geared towards business and does an excellent job of this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lavo10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Barcelona Levante football game, location perfect and rooms were very good, breakfast excellent and staff very helpful. if you are going to a Barcelona game this hotel is just a 5 minute walk. Only downside is that the drinks are expensive but plenty of other bars close by.

Reviews.Title: “Princesa Sofia”
Reviews.Author: Kiki051
Reviews.Content: This is a typical "Seventies" high-rise building, which could be a disaster in comparison to all the "boutique" hotels abundantly available in Barcelona. However, it is very clean, in good condition although aged, with large rooms, good bedding, nice facilities (a nice spa in particular), very good service, a nice breakfast with lots of choice (difficult to get the wiater's attention for coffee however!). Location could appear to be a problem, but the hotel is near an underground station and the Barcelona Metro is clean, fast, efficient, as well as the city buses. Car rentals are available if you want to go visit Catalunya (nobody needs a car in Barcelona). The concierge has an arrangement with a local car rental. Cheaper than the majors, perfectly OK from a customer service POV (car delivered and picked up at the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yellandrock
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early November 2011 and booked a Club Room. Check in and Check out all carried out in the relaxed atmosphere of the Club. You pay more but not significantly and it is a great place to meet business guests. Complimentary drinks and snacks available with a nice view over the city. I found it very relaxing and the staff in the Club Room were charming and helpful. Location is away from city centre, Rambler boulevard etc but I personally did not find that to be an issue. Metro outside and taxi rides into town not overtly more expensive than any other European City. The room was a touch old fashioned and maybe a bit tired but perfectly serviceable. Found the restaurant to be a touch hectic because there was a conference on, but again you can avoid the crowds by eating breakfast in the Club Room. I would recommend this hotel. It is not great but it is absolutely functional and perfectly acceptable for most tastes in my opinion. Yes, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a 5 star hotel for the '80s, maybe '90s”
Reviews.Author: littlekimms
Reviews.Content: the hotel is close to camp nou, but far from center, yet there is a very good transportation system. the hallway looks OK, kind of 4 stars hotel, the rooms are large, the breakfast is absolutely great, almost the best ever the general aspect of the hotel makes it look old and it needs a refurbishment very soon. the furniture is old and it looks like they took it from garbage, no coffee or tea facilities in the room, internet only paid and still they have the biggest conference place in Barcelona they wash the carpets on the hallways of the rooms Sunday night from 9 to 11 pm with all the noise and the people on the front desk asked us to tell his colleague to stop making the noise, they did not even pretend to try solve the problem or apologize. there are prostitutes in front of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great three-star... Good four-star (someone forgot to remove one or two stars)”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Milan
Reviews.Content: After a promising hall and check-in desk, the maintenance of the rooms and business centre (floor -1 and -2) are not up the expectations and to the 5 stars. The room showed its age and the bathroom, once elegant, lost its good standard. The whole room was still clean but quite worn out. Some hiccups impacted my stay: the safe was not working (in the first room it was really KO; in the second room it only needed a restart by the security guard); the wake-up call did not work the first morning (the other mornings it did and –just to be sure- a “human voice” called me to make sure). The location is good for Barça football or for conferences on site. Anyway you can comfortably reach the city by 5 minutes walk + 15 minutes underground trip. 20 euro far from the airport (by taxi). Helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “The conference was here - I would not stay here - too big and from previous decade”
Reviews.Author: othello2000
Reviews.Content: This is one of those huge hotels that were built out of the immediate city center (15min by taxi) in the previous decade. You can feel its age. For big conferences there is not much choice. I would never stay in such a hotel. And the catering during lunches was quite terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: zan15
Reviews.Content: Like many others before us we really did not think this hotel was worthy of the 5 stars, the room was a little tired and in need of a revamp but we still had a wonderful stay. The staff could not have been more kind and helpful, they arranged cake and Cava for my daughters 21st Birthday and did their best to organise a night out for us. It is in a great location to visit Nou Camp and there are some good shopping malls nearby. The hotel is away from the heart of Barcelona but it was really easy to travel to the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “It's an ok stay”
Reviews.Author: chc69
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights recently. check in/out: no problems experienced - was quick and efficient public areas: I didn't find them very pleasant. There is limited seating and little or no ambience. It didn't help that a security guard drifted by to ask if the bag beside me was actually mine. He was back some time later to ask the same question about the same bag. bedrooms: cleanliness was average - a couple of dark hairs in the bath but otherwise reasonable. The view was of the roof of the ground floor - covered in weeds and some old junk. restaurants: i only ate breakfast and it was good with plenty of choice and helpful staff staff: the restaurant and reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. They were the best part of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for FCB fans !”
Reviews.Author: SalmanShakeeb
Reviews.Content: We were there in July for 3 nights, its a good hotel with a great location for FC Barcelona fans since its just 10 minutes walk away from Camp Nou. There's an underground also about 10 - 15 minutes walk away from the hotel, which is very convenient, since it could take you anywhere in Barcelona. Don't miss La Rambla !

Reviews.Title: “Not impressive”
Reviews.Author: SPN_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Princesa Sofia for 4 nights in late October, 2011. For several reasons, I would not recommend this hotel to my friends. 1) After a long flight from USA, I arrived at the Hotel around 1:20pm. At the front desk, I was told that my room was not ready and that I should wait for half an hour or so. I was really tired and wanted to sleep, but I waited sitting on a sofa at the lobby. Then, I came back to the front desk at 2pm. Again, I was told that my room was not ready and that I should wait for half an hour or so. This time, I got a bit upset and told the clerk that I really wanted a room so that I could sleep, but anyway, the room was not ready, and I needed to wait for 20 minutes to get a key. 2) A desk lamp in my room was not functional. A floor lamp in my room did not have a bulb. Telephone connection was terrible (lots of noise and the call was suddenly terminated.) 3) I got a morning wake-up call around 7am, although I did not ask one. 4) I used small towels in the bathroom, and I did not get new ones next day. 5) The elevators are fast (this is a good thing), may be too fast for some people. 6) My bed was slightly smelly. 7) One (false?) fire alarm during the stay. I would not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Old and horrible”
Reviews.Author: kairo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has not been renovated since the 70ies when it was built. The service is good but this is the only positive about the hotel. Breakfast is more than disgusting - very little choice and everything is made based on conserves - they do not even use eggs but egg powder and other subsitutes to make omelette. Dreadful. In my room the bathroom was in an apalling condition - three large pathches of mold in the corners and in the shower. Internet is very expensive whereas it should be free as in Northern Europe. Barcelona has many hotels that are much-much-much better than Princesa Sofia at half the price. The location is not so good either, it is almost in the suburbs. Stay away unless you are forced to stay there by congress organizers as I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: holydolly
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the other reviews on this site made me worried, but I think this hotel is going through refurbishing since the carpet in the room looked new and so did some of the wall paper. I Found this hotel very comfortable but bear in mind that I was attending a conference nearby and the hotel was paid by the organizers. The breakfast room is spacious and there was a good variety. Found the business center hours to be a bit limited, and as in other hotels of this standard, the 24 wifi in the room was rather expensive (although they do have a 5 euro offer for one hour). Since this was not my first time in Barcelona I actually liked the location that is a bit far from the main tourist sites, on the very fashionable Ave. Daigonal, and with the many students walking on this street since the University is nearby Some good things to know – there is a "Corte Ingles" rather close that also has a supermarket (near the Maria Cristina metro station). There is a Starbucks and a pharmacy just below the hotel. Just adjunct to the Starbucks there is a restaurant called "ManGo" that served good and rather cheap local food. Dined there twice and was very happy about this choice. If you take the light rail from Pius XII station just outside the hotel till the last station Fransesc Macia –from there it is a nice walk on Diagonal Ave. till the Pedrera. You can also take the subway on the green line (either Palau Reial station or Maria Cristina), but the green line is shaped like a U, so not the shortest route. There are many taxis outside the hotel, but I didn't try taking them. If you are staying in this hotel, visiting Palau Reial de Pedralbes is a MUST – the garden is beautiful and I also liked the Ceramics museum located in the Palace.

Reviews.Title: “never five-star”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: Nice staff but old small rooms, old amenities and simply not five star. In top hotels you do not pay for pools and other simple services, here you do. Sadly like many hotels in Spain, the rating is just not a fair indication of the reality

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Ekskurziant
Reviews.Content: Definitely the hotel is not a 5 star hotel. Just look for good price and think this could be good 3 star hotel. No pool (if you pay extra - yes). Good but simple breakfast. Every extra stuff is really expensive for 3 star hotels. Smell (mostly come from old carpet) in some area and rooms is so bad. Old amenities in room and bathroom, clean and good linens and beds. Far from city center, close to Nou Camp.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired & in need of repair”
Reviews.Author: UncleDom
Reviews.Content: Well after the Ibis at Sant Andreu de la Barca it was a welcome change to have a bit of luxury here at the Princess Sofia. The entrance lobby was modern and welcoming & quite luxurious. Checkin was efficient and allocated room on the 6th floor. Room was quite large with 2 beds pushed together.Nice bed linens and room very clean. Very spanish bathroom with marbled tiles & large tub with overhead shower. Flatscreen tv and minibar so all set up. Plenty of wardrobe space and even trouser press. However room could have done with a little TLC as there was a lot of scuffing/wear & tear on the walls. Slept very well as high up so no street noise, it is at a busy junction not far from Nou Camp football stadium & big shopping mall nearby, also not far from Maria Cristina metro stop. Breakfast was included and was very good. Plenty of choice, super fresh juices but cooked breakfast items were not great & not very hot either, you were better to choose cold cuts, cheese, fruits & pastries. The coffee was pretty good too. One of my colleagues had room service at 1.30 in the morning at thought it was excellent. Last food orders in the bar were at 1.00, bar drinks were expensive though, 6 euro for a glass of red wine, go around the corner or to nearby Starbucks for cheaper. Did like the hotel but it was 9 stops from Drassanes/Liceu metro stop on the Ramblas so a little too far away from the night action, a taxi back was about 10 euro.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: jledesma
Reviews.Content: This hotel was unbelievable! From your room you can only call either the front desk or room service. You can't even call the operator. Right after check-in, we couldn't get the TV to work, so I wanted to call housekeeping or maintenance. There was no hotel telephone directory, so I called the front desk. It just kept on ringing; I kept on trying maybe 20 times. After almost 30 minutes, I went down to the front desk, and true enough, I was told we could only call the front desk and room service from the room; and that they could not answer the phone because they were busy! This was not a cheap hotel, and you have to go down to ask for something? Hello!!! Also, the corridor on our floor smelled damp, and the computer keyboards at the club lounge were ancient. Food was terrible at the lounge...Definitely not worth paying a premium for a club suite...

Reviews.Title: “Slow and poor service at reception”
Reviews.Author: blatham
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average, the air conditioning in the room is not great and the service at reception is SLOW.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: askjoey
Reviews.Content: Overcharged for buffet lunch. Followed up with #1 customer service person she said she would give us a credit/ refund. Never heard back, Customer service person #2- hates their job and is sorry but that happened over 4 months ago and there is nothing they can do about it. I was told lunch buffet was 25 E per person. The bill came to 110E for 2. Talk about lost in translation. If your going to stay at this hotel learn Spanish ASAP!!

Reviews.Title: “Great quality and the right price”
Reviews.Author: Ignacio007
Reviews.Content: Classical hotel where the service is a must and the installations are simply perfect: rooms, breakfast, swimming pool, lobby ... We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit and still delivers.”
Reviews.Author: BillyBobWiltshire_UK
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd visit to Princesa Sofia in Barcelona and it still doesn't disappoint. A very plush, airy hotel with large bedrooms and great service. A little bit away form the action down by the beach, but buses and local tube only short walk away…..10 mins ride into town. Hotel is located in the commercial area (banks etc) and benefit is that it’s much quieter at night. Touristic Bus stops right outside the hotel and is a great way to see and learn about Barcelona. The breakfasts are fantastic – try for a deal that includes breakfast. Highly recommended – enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a crisis”
Reviews.Author: accident_tourist
Reviews.Content: Club floor customer here. You can palpitably feel the crisis in Spain when you see how far behind the hotel is on its capex schedule: stained carpet, worn furniture, old air-con, torn wallpaper. Over-ambitious staff reduction lowers level of service. Despite the clean, comfortable bed (laudable achievement!), the hotel is still on the super luxury decor it had ten years ago. Note wifi signal so bad in the room that I decided not to pay for the EUR19 per day charge. All said, GREAT VALUE for money as I paid crisis price for the room, great buffett breakfast included. Other negative reviewers here should play fair: you can't expect a real five-star when you pay 3-star price! I mean, if the hotel is desperate enough to do discount deals for Barça football fans on weekends, you should adjust your expectations accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Flying visit but very good”
Reviews.Author: emmanuel137
Reviews.Content: Can't say too much as I arrived at 7pm one night and was gone by 9 the following morning, but overall was very pleased to have chosen this hotel. I stayed here because my first choice (AC Suites) was fully booked but I wasn't disappointed (although the wifi - which is chargeable - was a bit temperamental so I gave up with it). The bar area was very nice indeed and service throughout the hotel was excellent. I had to do another overnight trip to Barcelona a few days later and very sadly this hotel was fully booked, so stayed at the Husa Arenas up the road which was a few Euros cheaper but awful by comparison. The room was good but not as plush as the rest of the hotel which I find very common in hotels generally. Overall, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly standard business hotel, getting on a bit.”
Reviews.Author: MustoSnuggs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a business conference recently. The hotel is generally ok but uninspiring. They never did anything particularly badly, other than not having the room ready on my arrival (4pm), but neither was anything particularly great. Being more specific, the food was distinctly average, the location is on the metro but a long way from the city centre (although it is excellent for the Camp Nou), the hotel has a swimming pool but expect to pay an additional €12 for the privilige of using it, the lift system struggled to cope with the size of our group (expect to wait), and the decor is generally getting on.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service, close to Barcelona FC grounds”
Reviews.Author: IrishSel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a curise. The service at check in was great, as they allowed us to check in at 10am but when we got up to the room, there was clearly another person still in the room - I think they were in the shower We quickly left and reported it to reception who upgraded us to a better room, which was gorgous. We didn't eat in the hotel expect for breakfast which was nice. The concerige was very helpful and gave us a lot of advice on what to do and how to get about Barcelona. I woluld recommend this hotel if you didn't want to be right in the middle of noisy Las Rambles.

Reviews.Title: “better than W”
Reviews.Author: anka6
Reviews.Content: after 1 week in W barcelona and Sophia I could easily say that this is better than W (if you are not young russian). great location diagonal, we didnt get robed for all week!! around barceloneta and rambla this is not possible. large lobby, dicent rooms, with view over city or FC Barcelona stadium. good conection to all over city, great shopping area (3 corte inglese shops and other), good bed and silence through day/night, polite staff, good breakfast. probably best value for 5star in barcelona if you get speciual offer, a lot of bussines guests

Reviews.Title: “Extremely human welcome and services”
Reviews.Author: Nejib_carthage
Reviews.Content: the staff is very friendly. The view of the panoramic restaurant is amazing and the breakfast is very correct. Prices are a little bit expensive but ...

Reviews.Title: “"Big Bruiser" of a Hotel; living a little on past glories.”
Reviews.Author: Nubiann
Reviews.Content: For the traveller who does not know the Princesa Sofia. This hotel is a Large high rise, just on the periphery of the city centre. There is no doubt that the hotel once commanded a five star rating but at this time I would say four star would be a fairer. My room was quite spacious mine was a double on the 9th which afforded some decent views over the former Olympic areas and was very well insulated against traffic noise being adajacent to the "Diagonal" one of the main arterial routes into the city centre. The room had stood the test of time reasonably well but on close inspection you can see where many rersidents and time has taken it's toll; I could not say this means shabby, that would be unfair but compared to some Boutique Hotels I have stayed in recently, this is a little dated. My room had bathroom halogens lights, a number of which were not working with one hanging down from its fitment. A ceiling panel was also missing, exposing the plumbing and electrics of the room above mine; being and inside bathroom, good lighting is a pre requisite. I appreciate that the non functioning halogens were replaced on day 2 but not the ceiling panel but surely these problems should have been noticed when the room was being prepared for it's next occupant. Maybe the result of this cavity exposure, the bathroom became more affected by a drain smell which while not life threatening was unpleasant at times. My room swipe card became corrupted which neccessitated a trip to the Lobby in order to rectify; in isolation this would seem a very minor point but other guest reviews complained about this also, so you would expect this problem to be erradicted but seemingly not. My television and internet service stopped working for a while before an engineer fixed the problem albeit reasonably quickly. Staff were generally friendly and reasonably helpful but I got the impression that the lady chef became a little irritated with my breakfast request for Eggs Benedict and shrugged her shoulders saying I would need to wait.. I was more than prepared to but when it came the dish was dissapointing with over poached eggs and hollandaise which was rather unpleasant! I immediately recalled a comparison with 'Unicus', a city centre hotel in Krakow that I had the pleasure of staying at just a week before; My request there was greeted with a welcome smile and a 'delighted to' attitude which showed in the dish, which was executed beautifully and served with aplomb. Breakfast generally at the Princesa Sofia offered a reasonable choice but the produce was not perhaps at the five star standard; I would add that the waiting staff were very good, attentive and pleasant to talk with. I would say that the Princesa Sofia is getting very near the time when a major facelift will be due. There is obviously some work going on all the time in Hotels as large and complex as this one but when this happens, the measure is, how well guests are insulated aginst this work. I always judge Hotels by the attention to details and the simple things that give you signals that this Hotel is indeed in the five star bracket. As an example the Lobby; on first glance it is grand and quite mpressive with a huge central chandelier but look closer and you notice quite a few of the light bulbs that make it so impressive are actually not working. If I managed this hotel, things like this would be expected to be replaced on a daily basis; IMO this eye for detail sets you apart from the competition! There were not enough satff available in the main lobby sometimes, to accomodate new guests arriving and unacceptable at this level, forming a queue! I stayed three nights in total and on the whole it was fine; but if a Hotel sets itself up as a five star, prestige establishment, it must be prepared to be judged by these standards and in this respect it fails to deliver a five star experience. That is not to say my stay was unpleasant, it wasnt but in the final anaylisis Princesa Sofia needs some TLC and investment. if this was forthcoming, I am certain it can again present itself as a Hotel that offers the cossetting and service that a genuine five star hotel can and must deliver. Before I close, a lttle about the location; I travelled into the tourist areas on a number of occasions and this was very easy via either the 'Maria Chrstina' or 'Paula Reial' Metro Stations both equdistant to the hotel in opposite directions; the Metro was fast, Clean and Modern. Taxi's though are a different matter. Yes they are abundant but all too often get caught up in the thorrendous Barcelona's traffic system making them both expensive and stressful! In closing, There is still much to enjoy about the Princesa Sofia; on balance I would still recommend it but I do hope they soon undertake a schedule of works that would bring this behemoth of a Hotel bang up to 21st century style.

Reviews.Title: “Chemical Smell in the Air”
Reviews.Author: Professor44
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to a busy street so even on the highest floors there is traffic noise--it is also near the soccer stadium so there are crowds and noise when there are games. The restaurant buffet is bad--both breakfast and dinner the food is overcooked and not of great quality. But this is the biggest problem: the hotel is redecorating and because it has decided to go for the cheapest quality materials (carpet and wallpaper), the chemical smell is overwhelming. If you have any kind of allergies or sensitivities, stay away. The service is pretty good, particularly on the club floors (although the club food is nothing special). Also, like many older hotels in Europe, there has been no upgrading of the infrastructure so the air conditioning is sort of on or off--the thermostats don't seem to work.

Reviews.Title: “Shower curtain is a PAIN! Susanna @ Front Desk very GOOD!”
Reviews.Author: Mokxa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was generally OK - location was not the greatest. But Old Town Barcelona is not too far away by Metro. Some incidents: getting mugged on the Metro; wallet picked at a restaurant, laptop stolen in hotel room. But, if one is careful and keeps their eyes open, one can avoid these problems. The biz center rates were rather high. For me, the absolute WORST thing about the hotel was the bathroom shower curtain!! Impossible to have a decent shower, because the curtain would fly in and constantly press up against you - icky! The curtain is TOO LIGHT - needs more weight at the bottom to hold it down. Plus they should put in the new outward curving curtain rods to provide more shower space. Another issue was that the staff very calmly cleaned out my personal food items from the Mini-Fridge (wine and yougurt). However, "Susanna" from the Front Desk was absolutely THE BEST and replaced these items very cheerfully - exhibiting excellent customer empathy and service. Very professional of her, indeed. Susanna should be commended by the Hotel Management :-) !

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: windchaser4
Reviews.Content: Here for a conference. Service at front desk was a bit slow but then again when there are so many with a conference that is par. Elevator service very slow. Rooms a bit small and tired looking. Wallpaper curling up on a few edges, wood trim splintered and worn. Bathtub/shower very narrow. Club room service was excellent with great tapas, drinks, newspapers, free wifi and computer use, and breakfast items. Great space for small meetings with others. Metro two blocks away along with a great department store for picking up gifts. HopOn/HopOff bus stop right behind hotel. Watch for pickpockets, since two of our colleagues were caught only two blocks from hotel taking a leisure stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: hardy_ho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located central in the city but is very easy to get to on the metro As with other reviews I thought the hotel was slightly dated. I found the staff very friendly, attentive and willing to assist. The room was comfortable and had a very good nights sleep. My only gripe concerns the price I paid for a nights stay. Within a week of being there the price has dropped considerably. Didn't have breakfast as the price quoted was on the high side. I'd certainly use the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “We have been stolen in this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ERGUNBASKAYA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel between the dates 27.04.2011 - 02.05.2011 for the Cicils conference. On 1st of May, my wife was at the cafe of the hotel and somebody stole her bag in the hotel's cafe. We have totally about 1500.-eur loss because of this steal!! Nexy day we had a metting with the hotels general manager but they didnot care about this problem. We would not stay in that hotel but we had to stay there. But we advice the people NOT TO STAY in that hotel because there is a big security and management problem in the hotel. During our stay there there has been total 7 more thiefs. So We will never stay in that hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: pvallari
Reviews.Content: even if the hotel sometimes seems a little bit "old" it is always an excellent hotel close to Barcelona Business Center (and metro line). 100 euro / night included breakfast is an optimum price for this level of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel, little more 4* than 5*”
Reviews.Author: ftn61
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel a few times about 7 yrs ago. In that time it was just renovated, and now it has to be done again. The hotel is a little bit outdated. Rooms are nice but bathrooms need attention. Further breakfast for a 5* is not good enough, it's nice but again more 4* than 5*. Also WIFI or internet should be free. The staff although is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recommeded for BARCA'S funs...”
Reviews.Author: erimin
Reviews.Content: A liitle bit away from city centre... but too close to Camp No Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star Hotel - needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: brainbit
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 days / 4 nights in this hotel attending a conference. The hotel seems to require a renovation since the furniture in the rooms is overused. The wallpapers in my room was detached in some areas. All services very expensive. r.g. training room 12EUR/day

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving 5 stars, for sure”
Reviews.Author: baletta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very conveniently located for my exigencies. However, the standard resulted to be quite poor with respect to other 5 stars hotels I visited. I booked a business room, not very large to be honest. Free wi-fi was available for 15 minutes only (+ 1 hour being it a business room, but I had to get in touch with the reception). The cost for wi-fi connection was then not negligible (5 euro/hr). I was assigned a smoking room without being asked in advance whether this was acceptable to me. I had to leave the hotel for a meeting soon after checking in , and I had no time to have it changed. The smell in the room was significant. When opening the window to have some fresh air coming in, I noticed that the curtains were definitely in need of some washing. Taps in the bathtub showed relevant deposit and did not appearto have been cleaned with great care. I threw a make-up wipe in the trash can and it was on the ground in the evening. I found a pair of USED collant (from previous guests) in a drawer. The hairdryer was not a hanging one, but rather a "normal" one, and was hidden in the wardrobe. I had not opened the wardrobe and the first morning I could not dry my hair after shower. The breakfast offered a wide choice, but the service was not that efficient (few waiters, with very low understanding of English). My table-mate ordered an espresso AND a glass of hot water, and she received the two items....in the same big cup! Scrambled eggs were definitely undercooked. Croissants were excellent, and a large variety of fruit and juices was available. I had no time to visit pool & spa. The cost (12 euro per day) seemed however to me to be excessive for a facility offered as a complimentary service in other 5 stars I visited

Reviews.Title: “A good 4 star hotel, does not deserve the 5th yet”
Reviews.Author: pballi
Reviews.Content: WHAT I LIKED: Last minute price (through Expedia) about 100 euros per night The location is fine if you don't mind taking the metro for 15/20 min until the center. The tourist bus stops just in front of the hotel. The Camp Nou stadium lays just 5 min walk from the hotel The breakfast was good in terms of quantity but the service was extremely "friendly" Taxis for 15 euros leave you in the center Very complete wellness center with nice indoor pool I DIDN'T LIKE: No bellboy helped us with the suitcases when we arrive to the hotel Upon arrival we got a room with different beds than requested and came down to change room. Normally a 5 star hotel gives 2 copies of the key for a double room but they just gave one. They didn't excort to the room which was surprising for a 5 star hotel and having the front desk empty of guests The keyboard of the computer at the reception was extremely dirty. They don't have a safety box in the room!!! There was no turndown service Internet was expensive and the business center was 2 pc's Something that I found even in 3 star hotels is the emergency alarm that guests can pull in the shower or bathtub but here it was missing!!! The concierge gave very little information when asking info about city sightseeing and you must ask many questions to get what you really need to know. I asked upon check-out to credit the stay to my airline miles program and they said that it was impossible because I booked via Expedia... I asked my airline company credit my stay in my card and they did, so there is nothing impossible. In general it is a hotel that gives good value for money but don't expect a true 5 star hotel in terms of service and product.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Eyuche
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little bit old, but still a nice experience. The bed was really good to sleep in and breakfast was very diverse and great.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from many sites. Hotel is very, very tired and old”
Reviews.Author: kappatraveler
Reviews.Content: Many common areas of hotel are old and tired (sofas look like they are 20 years old.) Internet connection is spotty and expensive. Not enough power outlets for business convention. Food is salty and very little choices offered. Bathroom was questionably clean. Marble was stained and just did not look fresh. Bed was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Walkerfamily
Reviews.Content: Choose this because we were going to watch a match at the Nou Camp also wanted a quality hotel for Birthday treat,stayed 3 days on the 2nd day when retuning to the room there was a tray with a bottle of champagne and birthday cake and a card from the management, they had noticed from our passports the date of birth, wow what service is that! Cannot fault hotel big swish feel,great facilities and breakfast superb. There is a little local bar opposite which is great for a beer and a few tapas. Easy to get in to the town centre by either taxi or bus or metro. Would return no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't EVER come here!”
Reviews.Author: VICTORIAPRINCIPLE
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star NEVER a 5 star. We arrived for a weekend on the 25 Sept for 3 nights. The service was extremely slow, the staff just seemed too busy to attend to your needs bar one member of staff, Iguacio. The room was very basic and the corridor smelt of stables. Breakfast was Ok and perhaps the best thing about this "pension¨ masquerading as a hotel. The concierge service was non-existent and when we did find him, his knowledge of Barcelona was just that of a tourist. Glad to be going home. We will be back to Barcelona but we will be staying at the W Hotel ! Please AVOID THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: kittenmagic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite a way out of town but easy enough to use the metro to anywhere central, also really handy for the airport (only 20 Euros in a taxi) The hotel itself is nice, rooms ok, nothing special but clean. The pool is a bit strange, it says that there is an outside pool and an inside pool but really there is just one that is covered. It's a nice pool but quite pricey - would be good if it was included in the stay. We didn't eat or drink here because previous reviews said not to and it was quite expensive when we looked. Staff were all pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “For his location-not to close to the center- a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: dimitris12
Reviews.Content: In a logical price very good choice for this area -av.diagonal-,near camp nou, big shopping stores, in a high surrounding area. Very helpfull staff, excellent fitness services and cleanliness. Considering his restaurant and biergarden facilities it was a succesfull and happy staying in it, nevertheless some bath shower had not the modern mobile system, that i prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Service”
Reviews.Author: TelAvivShalom_S
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 nights stay in end of August 2010 and can definitely say it was a excellent choice. Location is great. Hotel and rooms are very nice . Break feat was very good. I agree that pool and Internet cost money but u can book package with pool and pay as u need for Internet. Any how after adding interned the hotel was relatively very chip and a good value for money. Would definitely consider coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “they charge you extra to swim!”
Reviews.Author: Blainey88
Reviews.Content: Almost 20 Euro per day charge for wifi!! Could probably rent a 3G modem for that price. And they also charge guests to use the pool...not very 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “a very comfortable overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: 187510Tina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive room, which was very large and comfortable The executive lounge was a welcome respite in an otherwise very busy hotel, We drove to Barcelona, and the location of the hotel was ideal, easy to find

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: dromack
Reviews.Content: Hotel located on the main street of Barcelona. A few steps to the nearest metro station. Check in and check out very fast. Rooms clean. Nice, helpful and friendly staff. A great swimming pool and spa, all for just over 12 euros per day. No free internet (with the exception of club room). Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “12 euros to use the pool!!!”
Reviews.Author: flightops75
Reviews.Content: nice hotel and very pleasant staff but felt the charge of 12 euros to use the pool was really pathetic. rooms were nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “food and drink expensive. good location for nou camp”
Reviews.Author: aoibhemopsy
Reviews.Content: dated hotel in need of refurb. not a great 5 star hotel. cost of food and drink very expensive. a burger is €18 and 2 drinks in bar €19. reception staff very friendly with great English. close proximity to camp nou which was ideal for us as we went to see a football game there. hotel is situated a 10min metro ride to city and metro stop is only 2 min walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “incredible stay at Princesa Sofia”
Reviews.Author: Cara1009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Me and my partner were over the moon to have found such a great place to stay. The hotel was 5 star and certainly lived up to expectation. We stayed in a club room which are on the 16th and 17th floors of the hotel. These rooms give exclusive use of the club lounge on the 18th floor this is also where you check-in. The club lounge provides food (continental breakfast in the morning and tapas in the afternoon and evenings) along with drinks free all day from 7am-11pm. free internet access in the club lounge is all available anytime of day. We also took up our complimentary 15 minute massages which I must say was fantastic! We booked this hotel through Holiday Nights online and expected b&b only however, due to the club lounge facilities we saved most of our spending money which was great. The room was huge very clean and we were provided with water and chocolates as soon as we entered the room! Bathroom was also very clean. Room service every day and staff were very helpful and friendly!!! The hotel is just on the outskirts of the city centre about 10 minutes walk from the Nou Camp football stadium however, we travelled to and from la rambla and most places via subway. The closest station to the hotel is 5 minutes walk to Maria Christina. I would definately go back to Barcelona it's a really great place for city and beach! I would not stay anywhere else other than this hotel it definately made our trip :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great if You Are Traveling for Business...”
Reviews.Author: CoolBreeze2010
Reviews.Content: It's quiet, the beds are comfortable and the staff is very helpful - what more do you need? I have stayed in this hotel multiple times on various business trips to Barcelona and have never been disappointed. There's a taxi stand outside, which always has someone ready and willing to take you to your next meeting. The Internet connection is fast. Room service is faster. You have everything you need within a 2 block radius - grocery store, pharmacy, restaurants - even a Starbucks. Should you be lucky enough to stay over the weekend, the Maria Cristina metro is only a block away and can take you into town to do some touring/shopping. However, above all of these perks, the best aspect of Gran Hotel Princesa Sofia is the staff. Everyone, and I mean everyone - consierge, cleaning crew, bartenders - is professional, courteous and beyond helpful. That alone puts this hotel above all others I have stayed in while visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lebtraveller
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel with my husband for our honeymoon. we had a really enjoyable stay. the staff were so great to us, always friendly and helpful. we loved the breaksfast buffet but had hoped there would be more variety in the lunch and dinner menus. the room service is awesome but failed to provide us with what we wanted only once during our 5 day stay. i had also hoped we would get a double bed instead of the two singles pushed together, especially that we told them we were honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carpetking5432
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in the club rooms which gave free access to the private lounge which opened from 7am to 11pm. From midday onwards its served tapas and free soft drinks and beer of an evening it had a full bar that was well stocked and provided for all tastes. The rooms were fantastic and of a very good standard up on the 17th floor so had a peaceful night sleep every night. They were clean and had a good sized bathrooms. Made regular use of the gym and swimming pool that were free for club room members and even took advantage of the free massage. The lounge served a cold breakfast buffett whilst the main resturant served a full hot and cold service. Plenty of places near by to eat at and the beer at the German themed bar was most welcome on my first night. Would go back anytime. Also this is the team hotel for FC Barcelona so expect to see the odd famouse face

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: vkm007
Reviews.Content: Great Concierge and nice facility. Located around the corner from Camp Nou. Exceptional in all ways, there a bit more nickel and dimeing than necessary though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but expensive for what they offer”
Reviews.Author: jet242
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend. The room was HUGE and the bathroom had a decent size; the bed was excellent. Everything was very clean. But was very expensive (and we didn't even have breakfast!). You better spend your money in something less expensive if you're going to be out and about all day long, because there isn't much you can enjoy in there, and many 3 stars offer very similar quality (except for the gym and other ammenities). And it's far away from the city centre, so you have to take the subway (like 15 minutes) or a taxi to get there. Overall: decent and nice hotel (mostly for business, maybe), but frankly overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christos M
Reviews.Content: Visited Princesa Sofia for a conference. I agree with other reviewers that the rooms are in an urgert need of a refurbishment. This hotel is perfect for business events and football matches. For other purposes I beleive that better options are available.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star - rooms need refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: MalachiWilliams
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a work event that was based in the hotel over three days. The location of the hotel is OK, but it is nowhere near the fun/action and it is a 30-45 ride on the underground/subway to get anywhere decent. The food at the hotel was good and there was certainly plenty of selection and the quality was good, but the prices in the bar are higher than I would have expected at 5.80 euros just for a coca cola. The bedrooms do need work. The rooms look tired and would benefit from an update which could easily be achieved on a cosmetic level without the need for a complete refurbishment. I was in 1126 and the room standard was anything but 5 star, but it was very clean and very tidy. The housekeeping standards are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Persson-Karlsson
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with good location near Nou Camp. I did not use the restaurant so I have no opinion about the services there. Positive: Very service minded staff, the location. Negative: a bit outdated rooms, the WLAN did not work during my stay. With a refurbishing the hotel could be perhaps the best in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “5* service, even if it is a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: waj50
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for just 2 nights 14th&15th Sept. 09. I booked after seeing a National Newspaper Advertisement on the Hotel. It was an offer so i didn't pay the usual tarrife. It is listed as a 5* hotel and we certainly got 5* treatment. On arrival at Reception, Carlos could not have been more helpfull. After some small talk he gave us 2 free drink tokens to be used in the bar, (Only house wine or beer or certain cocktails were available, but it was a nice touch). He also told us we had 1hr free internet access if required. As we had only booked a Standard Room and not a Club Room we would have to pay 12 euros extra to use the pool. We were only staying 2 nights so didnt use it, i think maybe as a guest they could have included that. Carlos explained that if there was anything we needed to know then his staff were available 24/7 and could be contacted by our room phone. He explained the direction of the bus routes and the underground, which was in easy walking distance of the hotel. The world famous Nou Camp Stadium, the home of Barcelona Football Club is within walking distance too. Make sure you take the street at the right of the hotel, go down then turn right at the bottom. On arrival in our room we found it to be quite spacious, a decent view of both the mountains to the right and a tree-lined avenue to the left. The bathroom had all the usual toiletries along with large bath towels and 2 soft bath robes and slippers. A 32" Sony Bravia tv sat on the cabintet at the end of the bed and plenty of reading material on the hotel was available. There were no tea & coffee making facilities but one phone call to the desk sorted that in minutes. We stayed on a B&B basis and it was served up until 11.00am. It was the usual help yourself buffet with plenty of choice. We found the restaraunt to be quite pricey for an evening meal, but there was also the option of eating in the bar area, which was also tastefully decorated and never overcrowded. There are a few restaraunts close by if you only wanted to stroll for your evening meal. All in all i would stay here again as my experience was pleasant. You can never please everyone all the time so i guess its all down to taste and what you expect. If your not the real snobby type then this hotel will not let you down.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you are going for a Barcelona match in Camp Nou”
Reviews.Author: Trond-Oslo
Reviews.Content: Average big city business hotel, just a few minutes’ walk from the stadium and the Barcelona FC museum. All the Barcelona players stayed in the hotel prior to the match. It was an extra bonus for my son, to see all the star players twice – even before the match. Me and my son was in Barcelona for a football match at Camp Nou, so it was very convenient to stay in Princesa Sofia. Being so close to the stadium, we could walk down one day for the football museum and the next day for the match. The hotel delivered what we paid for, and there was nothing to complain about. We had a good buffet dinner in the restaurant after our match, while most people were still in line for the subway outside our window. If not in Barcelona for several visits to Camp Nou, then you should stay more central.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: claire73
Reviews.Content: My friend and I enjoyed staying at this hotel. I was a bit concerned about what we would find after reading fellow traveller reviews. I can honestly say we didn't have a single complaint. The hotel was very easy to find, near the Maria Cristina Metro stop. The room was lovely and clean. The staff were very helpful. The food in the bar a bit expensive so we grabbed a snack over the road at a tapas bar when we arrived. There were some very nice restaurants very close by. We would recommend Mango, we enjoyed our meal there. Breakfast was impressive, plenty of fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, cooked breakfast, and cold meats. A bit disappointed that to use the pool there was a daily charge of 12 Euros, but we still enjoyed our dip. Overall we found it a great base because it was near a metro stop it didn't matter that it was not in the centre of Barcelona, we'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average business-type hotel”
Reviews.Author: soyyo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Princesa Sofia for a conference. I had read the reviews here and I was a little apprehensive, but the hotel wasn't too bad. My individual room wasn't big, but it was comfortable enough. It had a flat screen TV, but located on the desk (which was still large enough to use). The bathroom was fine, though the bathtub is sort of small. The condition of the room was fair. The carpets clearly need to be replaced, and at one point water started falling into my bathtub from the room above. Maintenance came right away, but they explained that probably the people above me had overflown their bathtub. Still, it would not have been fun had I actually been in the shower/tub when that happened. Service is pretty spotty. The people at the front desk were nice and helpful, but nobody offered to show me to my room. I don't ordinarily care for that anyway, but in this situation the room card didn't work (which meant I had to go back all the way back downstairs) and the light switches were sort of difficult to use. Plus a so-called 5-star hotel should offer that service. But this is not really a 5-star hotel, see it instead as your average, somewhat run-down, business class hotel and you won't be disappointed. What I disliked the most about this hotel is that they nickel and dime you. Internet service is extra (and quite expensive), breakfast is extra (of course) and incredibly overpriced. Indeed, food and in particular drinks at the restaurants are ridiculously expensive (E.6 for a tiny coke!). BUT, if you book your internet and breakfast when you check in they may give you a much better deal. Ask if they won't offer it. There is a starbucks and a couple of restaurants half a block away, so you don't have to eat there. There is a Corte Inglés with a supermarket about 2 blocks away, and tons of restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not my kind of 5*”
Reviews.Author: supertrampspud
Reviews.Content: Ok, so im 25 and not your regular business traveller. Stayed here when i was working at the tennis tournament up the road. The hotel is pretty darn nice, the breakfast out of this world, it was merely the cost of all the extra stuff that left a sour taste. On arrival i was knackered so ordered room service, some £23 for a pasta and a fanta. Wireless internet was 75 euros for 5 days, and there was a 12 euro charge per day to use the leisure facilities. Now maybe im just not accustomed to 5* business hotels, but when im paying over 100 euros a night, i find it a bit insulting to pay extra for wireless internet and use of the pool. The room itself, while pleasantly decorated, was small and nothing special. Personally, unless you got money to burn, i'd rather stay somewhere with bigger rooms and free internet and free use of the pool at a fraction on the price, having a hairdryer, dressing gown, sewing kit and emery board in the bathroom just doesn't do it for me. That aside, breakfast was great! Champagne, fry up, omelette, fruit, pastries, cereal, the works. Location is decent enough, close to the metro, but not many restarants/bars around

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Princess Sofia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulpierce
Reviews.Content: Has a great service and the lobby was more than spacious. The rooms were very cozy and confortable. The only problem was at the check out cause we had many people at the same time and nobody offer and alternative receptionist- But the overall experience was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel who's staff couldn't do enough to help.”
Reviews.Author: mickjmon
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Club package, slightly more expensive than standard rooms but worth every penny. Staff were very helpful and the facilities were excellent. Would gladly return again to hotel. 100yards to metro line L3 which dropped us in the middle of Barcelona within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, shabby with slow service”
Reviews.Author: peanut65London
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and felt that the hotel was tired and shabby. The service was very slow, the staff seemed uninterested in customer service. I would not recommend it to friends or colleagues. On my last morning I had breakfast in my room and had to send the tea cup back as it was filthy. The mini bar had mould growing in it.

Reviews.Title: “5-star "loosely defined"”
Reviews.Author: md713
Reviews.Content: The only positive about this hotel is the gym with relatively new equipment, and the clean, brightly lit common areas. The rooms are a different story. No water pressure ,or hot water, to speak of, a hole in the bathroom ceiling, dirty walls, dingy accomodations and beds that feel like concrete slabs. The housekeeping staff also decided to throw away clearly not-disposable items (like non-disposable contact lenses/case). Not really sure why this place is considered in the new "financial and shopping district" - didn't see any sign of retail in an entire week. We were clearly in what seemed to be the Detroit suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money, but not overly impressive!”
Reviews.Author: chlobo9
Reviews.Content: The lobby and exterior of this hotel were great. The staff was generally helpful, although we did have issues with service when requesting things from our room. We ordered glasses and towels and had to call again because not one brought anything. We also had issues with their internet, but they took the charges off of our bill, so I was satisfied with that. The rooms were in need of an update/renovation and had peeling wallpaper, bumpy carpet and strange vents which wafted cigarette smoke into our bathroom, even though our whole floor was smoke free. It was on the green line so taking the metro into town was not difficult. The stop is about a block and a half away. There is also a Starbucks on the way to the metro, which was nice. They allowed us to leave our car in the parking in front of the hotel instead of parking in the garage for 20 euro/day. The hotel restaurant was unimpressive, and expensive. We had the buffet one evening, and it was 30 euros per person, which I found steep since the food was not great. The concierge was helpful and able to point us toward nice restaurants. There was an ATM in the lobby, which was helpful as it is unsafe to go to some ATMs on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Allways good even better this time”
Reviews.Author: rachelamanda
Reviews.Content: We always try to stay in the princesa sofia when we go to barcelona as it never fails to to feel like a very special experience. This time I booked a special package with bookings.com and for 181€ we stayed in a club room with access to the club lounge which provides drinks and snacks all day long (the mumm champagne was excellent!) a back massage and entrance to the spa was included as was breakfast which could be taken in the main restaurant or in the club lounge. The staff as always were supper attentive polite and efficient. It really was absolutally brilliant and couldnt be faulted the only trouble is next time we will have to do the same as it would feel a let down to be just and 'ordinary ' guest!! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Bevyorks
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with what has been said, this is not a 5 star hotel, the interior is not bad, and the staff are ok. However the food we had was terrible, by husband does not eat meat or fish and they had a real problem with that (only grilled veggies). The room was a good size with all the things you would expect. There are much, much better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “5-star staff, but ...”
Reviews.Author: nuyawwka
Reviews.Content: Hotel has seen better days. Funiture in room and lobby was chipped and water-stained. Bedding was of 2-star quality. Wallpaper was peeling off walls. Management should be ashamed for letting hotel run down in such a manner. They should lose their 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaLondon2
Reviews.Content: Lucky enough to be visiting Barcelona on a short mid-week business trip. Barcelona has changed beyond belief over the last 10 years (since expo) This hotel has great communication and also lovely well mannered staff. I am fluent in Spanish but didn't need to any help getting information. I would recommend the hotel to anybody for a short break / weekend visit. We did not dine at the hotel, we found a lovely little tapas bar about 400 metres away (large menu)

Reviews.Title: “great weekend”
Reviews.Author: bettyireland
Reviews.Content: having read some reviews we were a bit sceptical about visiting this hotel but boy were we surprised my mum sister and myself went to celebrate my 40th birthday the service was excellant a beautiful hotel and just a nice distance from the centre fab pool and sun bathing area and food great too all in all a wonderful experience and would definitely return .barcelona is a fab city only problem we found was not a great amount of information on nice restarants to eat in outside hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: fadi
Reviews.Content: rooms are tidy , clean , well decorated .... best thing about this hotel is the location , its very close to the underground station that takes directly to the city centre (las ramlas ), and its very close to the stadium , if you are a football fan , then this is where u shall stay , its just 5mins walk to the new stadium of barca . The area in which the hotel is located is classy , ...all in all its highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5-star hotel, but not a bad hotel either”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Spain before, and stayed at this hotel for a work conference. The taxi driver on the way over told me it was one of the nicest hotels. I’m not so sure about that. The criteria for “5 star” in Europe must surely be very different from the US. I’m guessing the Sofia gets extra stars because of its size and ability to cater and hold large meetings? Other than that, I can’t see what would make it 5-star. While there was nothing wrong with the hotel, in my opinion it did not belong in the same family as your typical US 5-star establishments such as the Ritz or Four Seasons. Hotel: while not 5-star in my opinion there was nothing wrong with my room. Comfortable bed, spacious bathroom (with separate vanity area from toilet, which is always nice if you’re not staying alone) marble counters and plentiful toiletries. Rooms looked a little old, but all in all just fine, and cleaned thoroughly every day. Small, but no smaller than most european rooms. Concierge service was hit or miss depending who you got at the desk. Cost of food in the hotel is outrageous! Area: If you’re looking for a central location in Barcelona, this isn’t it. There is a tram outside the hotel, but I didn’t take it so not sure where it goes! There are a few little cafes next door to the hotel, and a giant dept. store a block down. Definitely venture out and buy your water/snacks outside the hotel – the walk is worth the cost difference. There is a monastery up the street from the hotel that is very interesting and pretty – definitely check it out if you have the time. Other than that, it didn’t seem like there was a whole lot to do around the hotel. All in all, the hotel was fine, but if I was travelling for pleasure I would not pick it. I stayed closer to the city center later in the trip after work, and would recommend finding a hotel closer to central Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oudec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip last weekend. Previous reviews are correct. This hotel is a good 3* or poor 4* at the best. Have to say the room was spotless but I had holes in my towels, frayed sheets and all of the furniture in the room was damaged and well past its sell by date, as was the carpet. Most of the staff at this hotel had an appalling attitude. They clearly do not like the english and are not afraid to show it. Take the advice of most of the reviewers on this site and avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, good location for football”
Reviews.Author: Shugsterhibs
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of nights as part of a works 'jolly', and was over when Barca played Man United in the football. The hotel itself is on the outskirts of the main city centre, and only minutes away from the metro station to the centre. The room I had was clean and good sized, and despite what other reviewers have said was in great condition. Breakfast was good and buffet style.
