It is only a couple of minutes from the Camp Nou, so if that's why you're visiting Barcelona it can't be bettered for location, and the tourist buses that go round the city pick up from there. That would also have a down side if Barca are playing and you're looking for peace and quiet, as 100,000 people coming out a stadium are quite noisy!! I would agree however that's it's not five star, and a rating of four would be far more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: GenW
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and this turned out to be my worst night in a hotel ever! Room was definitely not a 5 star standard - stains on the carpet, chips in the furniture - overall very tired looking. At around 1am I woke to the sound of water dripping and found water coming through the celing in the bathroom. The front desk were extremely rude and not very helpful - basically yelled at me they were trying to fix it. The water got a lot worse - it was gushing down and I could not use the bathroom. In the end I asked to be moved - they dropped off a key to my room around 2am but did not offer to help with my bag or anything. The room I was moved to was much nicer I must admit - it was on one of the top floors and must have been the next class of room up from the one I had been booked into. Checking in and out I had to wait for over 20 mins each time - a huge queue and not enough staff on. The location is not great for central Barcelona. The only positive I can think of was the breakfast was nice. I would not stay here again and it is most definitely not a 5 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “tired and falling to pieces”
Reviews.Author: mrsfed
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a conference and five stars it certainly is not. Rooms are adequate in size but falling to pieces (drawers especially) and need a revamp urgently. Bar prices are expensive - a small coke is 6 euros and a large beer 10 euros. Service OK - phoned about a couple of problems but never had any response despite their promises to call back, fix afore mentioned drawers ... Location reasonable - especially if you are there for the football - but I've stayed in better 3 star places in the heart of Barcelona - trip into the tourist centre of town is 30 minutes, good connections though - metro 5 mins, buses right outside. Facilities for conferences are excellent, and these and the communal areas like the lobby and bar are by far the most modern part of the hotel. unless you are staying for the football or for business stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “In serious need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: henryespagne
Reviews.Content: Not very welcoming, rated 5 stars but reality shows 3 stars at most. Some of the staff are helpful and others don't care, certainly understaffed. Stayed at the 4th floor and in my tiny room none of the pieces of furniture matched the other.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JETEngland
Reviews.Content: The star ratings of course relate to the overall hotel and not the room standard which is a shame as the room was very disappointing - tired decor and average, more like an English 3 star However, the restaurant, in particular the breakfast buffet, was very good and the service excellent Very disappointed at the fee to use the pool area, which again, was tired and dated. 12 euros per person. The bar and restaurant weren't cheap but we expected that due to the star rating, the choice, service and comfort were excellent A little distance from the Rambla which actually worked well for us as it felt unsafe at night and much safer in the hotel area of the City. Taxis were reasonable and the tram was easy to catch -right outside hotel although we found it difficult working the tarif out! Visit the Market area off the Rambla and the historic buildings in the day, which are interesting We took a tour on the open top bus which was 20 euros per person for a full day and we visited the old Spanish town which was great but again, expensive as we had to pay to gain entry c.10 euros each and then we got off the bus to visit the acquarium where there was a charge again. Its just as well it rained and we didn't stop off at other attractions as the monies were running out! Not good value for the day but if you want to see Barcelona there's not many options really All in all, Barcelona is a great City but be warned, its City prices we wouldn't pay for 5 star again in Spain

Reviews.Title: “Time for a revamp”
Reviews.Author: gazza613
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what the requirements are for being considered a 5* hotel. I am sure the Princesa Sofia hotel gets a tick in each category but I couldnt help but feeling that every item of furniture in the hotel belonged in the early 90's. Everything seemed old, worn, colours faded. I stayed on the 10th floor. The room was good for a 3 or maybe 4 star. I would describe it as plain. Bathroom was ok - usual bath/shower combo - probably the best part of the room. I thought 5.50 euros for a Coke from the minibar was excessive but I didnt fall for that trap. The rest of hotel was much of the same. Very large hotel with plenty of staff to greet you, all dressed very smartly to welcome you before you go through the doors, after you get in, while you walk to the from desk and finally once you get to the front desk. They were helpful enough though so no compaints but the place did feel a little pretentious - just a little to grand. The location is reasonable - depending on what you want to do. La Ramblas is a 10 minute taxi that will cost about 8 euros. Not walkable. I didnt try public transport. There are alot of shops in the area - about a 5/10 min walk and there are shopping centers, resturants and quite a vibey retail area on Avenue Diagnal. Camp Nou football stadium is a 10 minutes walk. As a tourist I would stay closer to to the coast next time - just a little far for what my intentions were. More suited to business travellers I would think.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay. 3* rooms not 5*”
Reviews.Author: Martin94
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in Dec 07. Rooms were fine, nice bathroom but expected more for a 5*. Didn't use pool or bar so can't comment, nice places close by for a bite or beer and half the cost. Public transport no problem, tram stop, bus stop right outside and metro 100metres away.Cost 6.50 euros for a T-Dia ticket which gave us 10 trips on the metro, bus, trams, great system. 22 euros taxi from airport. Good location for upmarket shopping. Staff were very good great english and very professional. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My experience better than most”
Reviews.Author: jwg01776
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat hesitant given some of the overwhelmingly negative reviews written here as well as one from a colleague whom had stayed here recently. However, I was pleasantly surprised. I found the front desk staff to be professional and courteous and they attempted to satisfy my requests. They weren't overly friendly but I found nothing negative about their behavior as some reviewers did. My chief complaint about the hotel is the 26euro/day internet charge (which is about $40 USD about now). This really is outrageous. I stayed at the hotel for six nights and wasn't about to pay this, even though my company was picking up the tab. I was attending a conference for three days a short distance away and just used the (free) internet access there. On a couple of occasions, I went down to the business center late at night and asked if I could send an e-mail or check my flights. I was told "of course". Other people did go and sign up and pay. Had I said I wanted to use a machine for a half hour or more, I suspect I would have had to pay as well. My room was o.k. Beware that the mattresses are very hard, although I slept quite well. I was not bothered by any noise, but I sleep with earplugs anyway :-) The bathroom was quite nice and there was a powerful shower head which I really appreciate. The overflow drain attachment on the tub wall was not secured and dropped out a couple of times - don't know why they didn't fix it - but it didn't bother me that much. The vanity was marble and the lighting in the bathroom was nice. The overall condition was good, but could stand some touching up. The furniture was a bit dated, but o.k. Also, the carpet, although not filthy as some reviewers stated, was a bit worn and a little dingy. I had difficulty turning on the lights when I first entered the room. It turns out you have to insert your room key card in a slot just inside the room when you enter. Otherwise, the lights and outlets are disabled. This is a neat energy saving device that other hotels should adopt. When you leave your room and take out the key card, the lights all go out. (Another advantage is you never have to hunt around your room for your key card before you leave - it's always in the slot). The breakfast buffet (included in my room rate) was absolutely wonderful. Smoked salmon, eggs, breads, fresh fruit, cereals, fresh juices, coffee, champagne!, mineral water, .... I looked forward to this everyday. Also, a similar lunch buffet is also very good. I don't think it was included in my room rate, but the one day I went in there and tried to ask the waitress for a bill she simply shook her head and shooed me away. Nice. I rented a bicycle during the whole stay. The porters and the concierge were absolutely great about locking the bike up every night in the baggage room and getting it for me in the morning. They also were very helpful when the bike rental guy was unable to pickup the bike on time - they held on to it for me to deliver safely to him when he showed up later. All in all a very pleasant experience -- but still wish they internet service was included (and the pool as well -- that was 12euros extra/ day - so I didn't step foot in it).

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the stadium”
Reviews.Author: Jenan2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prencesa Sofia hotel for two nights. I stayed in the business room on the 10th floor...The room was spacious but outdated. The furniture should be changed. The bathroom was good and spacious too but the bathtub was little old. Barcelona stadium is less than 5 minutes walking and my room has a stadium view. The breakfast was really nice and the waiters were quick and helpful. The hotel is 20 minutes by bus to the city center. The local transportation is available all the time and the bus stop is just out the hotel's door. The area is really quite and unlike the hustle and bustle of the city center but there are many restaurants and shops within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star, but certainly not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: jodastephen
Reviews.Content: This is a tower block hotel which houses a significant number of meeting rooms, mostly in the basement. It is five minutes walk to Maria Christina metro station, and from there it is about 20 minutes to the Ramblas/Harbour (direct). There is also a tram and many bus routes from directly outside. It is also just a short walk to the football stadium. The hotel is classified as a five star, but I would rate it as a good four star. There is porterage/concierge service and a grand foyer, but the desk staff were very slow and decidedly grumpy. The gym, pool and internet were not included in the room rate we had, which was for a conference. The room was a fairly standard size, but the bathroom was slightly larger than normal, and came with a bidet. Both room and bathroom were well fitted. The restaurant serves an excellent breakfast buffet, and a rather nice desert buffet too. However prices for the evening meal, bar snacks and buffet were rather expensive. Overall, it is a four star hotel pretending to be a five star. It was let down by very grumpy and slow desk service, lack of inclusive room services and expensive restaurant prices.

Reviews.Title: “Parading as a five star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: B&OSA
Reviews.Content: It is clear that the Princesa Sofia tries to be a five star hotel but it lets itself down on the following points: - There was no turn down at night, which we have come to expect in European five star hotels. - There was hair on the floor of the bathroom. - Members of our group complained of dirty carpets in their rooms - The plumbing in the bath and shower was faulty. - Any use of a bathroom within the hotel could be heard from all rooms. However, the rooms were spacious and well appointed. Many facilities were on offer throught the hotel including onsite ATM's and business centre. We also found the breakfast selection to be expansive. This is not a five star tourist hotel but it does cater very well for business travellers or those staying for a short period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the SPA”
Reviews.Author: StefanFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel for both business and leisure at 5 min from the stadium. They have a great SPA area with a chill-out garden to relax. The service was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katzavi
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a week vacation with the kids at this hotel. We took Junior suite + interconnected double room so we had plenty of space. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had free access to the club lounge and it was real pleasure with the free internet access food and drinks there. We also had free access to the spa center and used the (big) pool, Jacuzzi and (big) gym. Breakfast was ok and the staff was helpful and nice. On the other side I can say that the hotel is not cheap, especially the charge for laundry, DVD in the room, and also room service menu can be better. The bottom line - this is a good 5 star hotel, nothing fancy, not too modern, but reasonable good quality hotel option in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business, close to the Stadium.”
Reviews.Author: dottorsocrates
Reviews.Content: It is a modern hotel not a boutique one. I've been to this hotel 3 times in the last 7 years all the times for business purposes. The hotel is not in the center but the is the metro station very close by. Is in the Barcellona FC soccer team area since the Camp Nou is in walking distance, as well as the training area. So if you like soccer this is the place to go. Once occurred to me seat at the bar next to 2 brasilians playing at that time in the team. From the airport is about 15 minutes by cab. The rooms are big, clean and have all the conforts you might need.

Reviews.Title: “the worse hotel that I know”
Reviews.Author: nuthurralt
Reviews.Content: . I return after four horrific days at the Princesa sofia hotel . The stink in the rooms was terrible: It seems to stay in a sewer!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MelissaLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because we like higher standard properties and this was a good deal. The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly. The Metro stop is a 5 minute walk and it is a very easy trip to the center of old Barcelona. What made this stay so difficult was the fact that the beds in the hotel are VERY, VERY FIRM...it's like sleeping on the floor!! Both of our backs were killing us after 3 nights sleeping here! Also, we could hear a baby crying in the room above us ALL NIGHT LONG, so the floors did not drown out the noises from upstairs at all. Even the toddler walking on the floor upstairs was amplified and was loud. We loved Barcelona, but with the exception of seeing one of Gaudi's works (literally across the street!) we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Subperb Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: footballfans
Reviews.Content: Stayed with two teenage sons to attend a football match, paid a little extra for a club room on the 18th floor. Staff at check in were excellent , everything was done to order and nothing was too much for them. Have been to Barcelona several times but this was first time at this hotel and in terms of price to value/quality ratio i would have no complaints. Club staff even supplied a complimentry cake and drinks as i had mentioned when booking that it was a birthday treat. Breakfast was a veritable feast with even a cook on hand to do fresh omelettes etc and the staff were attentive without being intrusive. Views of the city from the upper floor are excellent and the staff and service in the club lounge is first class. Top end of city but a metro both to left and right on main avienda so getting around no problem. Overall an excellent hotel which justifies it 5 stars Bill and sons

Reviews.Title: “A solid business hotel - NOT in a tourist area”
Reviews.Author: RichRichRich
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights recently because my company held an event here. I would agree with other reviewers who comment that this is NOT a 5 star hotel, but it is a quality business hotel with all of the amenities that you would expect. The main thing that makes a 5 star hotel is the service. This hotel has passable service. Most of the staff is busy or indifferent. I have come to discover that this is typical of Barcelona, but I still don't appreciate it. The concierge gave decent but not outstanding recommendations. THIS IS NOT a good place to stay if you want to explore Barcelona as a tourist. It is close to a subway stop, but a LONG way from anything interesting.

Reviews.Title: “cant belive some people Quality!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: for starters I cant believe some people I stayed here in may for the barca game v espanyol I found the staff helpful and warm I have stayed in allot of 5 star hotels and im only 22 and I think people are being slightly blind to the fact that if you stay in a 5 star hotel then it will be expensive that’s the whole point isn’t it for them extra touches food was great and the hotel is super close to the stadium the only thing I would say is if you want to be near the town this hotel isn’t for you as its a good 10-15 minute drive with all them dam traffic lights. nuffsaid4@hotmail.com with any questions

Reviews.Title: “Terrible serive, stay away and save your money.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at this hotel and regret every second spending there. First staff is terrible, they were so busy and not helpful at all. We didn´t get any information about services they had, and they state that they have pool but if you want to use it you must pay 100euros/day. Nothing special at all so save your monet and find an other hotel that you will appreciate.

HotelInfo.Name: Gran Hotel Princesa Sofia
HotelInfo.Address: Plaza Pio XII 4, 08028 Barcelona, Spain
